mng: to tread on, to trample, to stamp, to fulfill, Taiwan pr. [dao4]

exm.mng: to tread on, to trample, to stamp, to fulfill, Taiwan pr. [dao4]
hands dance and feet trip (idiom); dancing and gesticulating for joy
to repeat, to follow the same road as
to follow the track of an overturned cart, to repeat a disastrous policy
to follow the compass and go with the set square (idiom); to follow the rules inflexibly, to act according to convention

exm.pyn: Běi jīng Wǔ dǎo Xué yuàn

exm.mng: to go through water and tread on fire (idiom); not afraid of any difficulty
follow the same old path (idiom); stuck in a rut, always the same routine
to leave office for a high and distant place (idiom); to retire and place oneself above the fray

exm.pyn: Háng dīng dùn wǔ dǎo zhèng
Hēng dīng dùn wǔ dào zhèng

exm.mng: see 發揚踔厲|发扬踔厉[fa1 yang2 chuo1 li4]
